Congenital, Hereditary, and Neonatal Diseases and Abnormalities/Genetic Diseases, Inborn/Metabolism, Inborn Errors/Lipid Metabolism, Inborn Errors/Lipidoses/Sphingolipidoses/Gangliosidoses/Gangliosidoses, GM2/Tay-Sachs Disease, AB Variant
Record.BroaderTerm: Congenital, Hereditary, and Neonatal Diseases and Abnormalities
Record.Description: A progressive neurodegenerative disorder that begins with muscle weakness, then progresses to startle reaction, retardation and seizures. It is characterized by the accumulation of G(M2) GANGLIOSIDE in neurons that is caused by a lack of G(M2) ACTIVATOR PROTEIN function. The AB variant designation refers to the increase of both HEXOSAMINIDASE A and HEXOSAMINIDASE B in tissues that lack of G(M2) activator protein.
